title: Baseball Stadium Postcard Checklist by Crabtree - SOLD
author: Greenmonster

posts.post_title: Baseball Stadium Postcard Checklist by Crabtree - SOLD
posts.post_content: Baseball Stadium Postcard Checklist by Crabtree, 1996 printing.  This is the first printing of this checklist, the later version included a price guide which this printing does not contain.  Excellent reference book for commercially produced and, then known, rare real photo major league baseball stadium postcards.  Softcover, 190 pages, excellent condition, used.  SOLD ppd Priority Mail.  Please PayPal Friends and Family or check/money order.  PM me to verify the book is still available.  Thank you.  Jim

Good afternoon.

I have just recently started collecting baseball stadium postcards and just heard about this book.  Apparently, it is extremely hard to find.  Do you happen to know if there is a digital version of this that I could buy/use just for reference as I cannot seem to find very many resources to identify publishing years?  My apologies if this comes across as a rude question, I definitely do not mean it that way.  I am just trying to learn more.

Thank you and have a great Friday!

Robbie

[quote name="theupps" post=1997804]Good afternoon.

I have just recently started collecting baseball stadium postcards and just heard about this book.  Apparently, it is extremely hard to find.  Do you happen to know if there is a digital version of this that I could buy/use just for reference as I cannot seem to find very many resources to identify publishing years?  My apologies if this comes across as a rude question, I definitely do not mean it that way.  I am just trying to learn more.

Thank you and have a great Friday!

Robbie[/QUOTE]

Hi Robbie,

The book was privately published about 25 years ago, I know of no  digital version.  Publishing years for a specific postcard us not listed in the guide.  The year is typically estimated based upon the type of postcard, prelinen, prelinen white border, linen, chrome, continental along with the view of the ballpark and what features may or not be present.  Such as newer seating, background buildings, auto styles, clothing styles signage, exterior/interior painting..... For real photo postcards the stamp block design is a key for estimating the date the postcard was produced.  Feel free to PM me with any specific questions.  Good luck with your collection.  Thank you.  Jim
I’ll take it. Please send payment info. Thanks.
